title.narrative: Food Security Program with Salesian Missions - Timor-Leste - 2016

description.narrative:
Salesian Missions is a network of 34,000 Priests, Brothers and Sisters around the world who work to enable poor and suffering children to live better lives and build brighter futures. The Salesians of Don Bosco operate 5,000 schools and technical training centers, 23 colleges, 216 clinics and hospitals, 225 orphanages and shelters, and run a wide variety of social and economic development activities throughout the world. In each country, the Salesians combine the aspects of an orphanage, a school, a church, and a children's recreation center, in addition to varied social programs.
In East Timor (Timor-Leste), a country that has suffered from much civil unrest, over one-third of the population regularly experiences food shortages. Therefore, providing nourishment to students is an important part of Salesian educational programs. In the Salesian technical school in Fatamuca, for example, the Salesians feed more than 250 students three meals a day, in addition to providing training in carpentry, electricity, machinery and electronics. The Salesians run twelve schools throughout the country - two technical, one agricultural, four secondary and five primary. In addition, they operate two large orphanages, and offer youth enrichment programs in each of the ten communities where they have a presence.
Stop Hunger now provides this program with 1 container of food assistance
